After a leisurely ferry ride to the island, this full day itinerary allows you time to explore the craggy coastline, ancient temples, white sandy beaches and caves which (we warn you) come with ghost stories! After a morning of creativity, get ready for an afternoon of action at Liangshan Recreation Area. An energizing hike trail will lead you to the Liangshan Falls, a gorgeous waterfall that is divided into three layers. A great place to swim and relax under the sun, as well as to cool off after the hike! Be sure to let yourslef take in the natural surroundings; the area is abundant in rare and exotic flora and fauna.

An evening tour that takes you to the ancient walled town of Hengchun before spending a few hours in the utmost relaxation of a hot spring spa Visit the best-preserved ancient town of Hengchun See the Fu Palace, a temple in the ornate Chinese style Relax at the luxurious Fennel Resort spa Enjoy a tasty dinner included in the tour Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Visit the best-preserved ancient town of Hengchun Visit the best-preserved ancient town of Hengchun See the Fu Palace, a temple in the ornate Chinese style See the Fu Palace, a temple in the ornate Chinese style Relax at the luxurious Fennel Resort spa Relax at the luxurious Fennel Resort spa Enjoy a tasty dinner included in the tour Enjoy a tasty dinner included in the tour Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off Inclusive of comfortable coach transportation including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Quaint and historical, this is an evening tour to give you the best of Hengchun, a town on Taiwan's southernmost tip. This ancient city, built in accordance with traditional feng shui and surrounded by an exceptionally well-preserved city wall, is a delightfully quaint memento of a Taiwan from the past. It's no wonder the city is a famous film set location and retreat for writers. Here you'll make your way to Fu Palace. Built in 1662, this temple (built in the Chinese palace style) is a popular site for annual Chinese festivities. End the tour with a few hours of utter relaxation at the Fennel Resort and Sihjhongsi Hot Springs. With various bubbling, massaging and healing pools, set in natural surrounds with the mountainous countryside as a backdrop, this really is a deluxe bathing experience.
strTitle: Hengchun Old Town and Hot Springs

strIntroduction: Breathe in the fresh air and bask in the beautiful scenery of Dasyueshan Forest Recreation Area Visit Dasyueshan Forest Recreation Area and witness the unforgettable views of the region's mountains and valleys Trail through the Shiaoshui and Anma mountains, and keep an eye out for the rare flora and fauna Enjoy afternoon tea at Rollin Farm, after a day of touring the surrounding region Free hotel pick up and drop off, lunch, afternoon tea and insurance are all included in the tour Visit Dasyueshan Forest Recreation Area and witness the unforgettable views of the region's mountains and valleys Visit Dasyueshan Forest Recreation Area and witness the unforgettable views of the region's mountains and valleys Trail through the Shiaoshui and Anma mountains, and keep an eye out for the rare flora and fauna Trail through the Shiaoshui and Anma mountains, and keep an eye out for the rare flora and fauna Enjoy afternoon tea at Rollin Farm, after a day of touring the surrounding region Enjoy afternoon tea at Rollin Farm, after a day of touring the surrounding region Free hotel pick up and drop off, lunch, afternoon tea and insurance are all included in the tour Free hotel pick up and drop off, lunch, afternoon tea and insurance are all included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: Dasyueshan (or “Great Snow Mountain”) Forest provides nature-lovers with a gateway to extraordinary sceneries of the surrounding, almost untouched mountains, as well as the chance to witness rare and exotic wildlife in their natural habitat. Kicking off at the Dasyueshan Forest Recreation Area, the tour extends towards the Shiaoshui mountain trail, followed by a detour through Anma mountain, where you can view verdant greenery, topped by the snowy mountain peaks. This tour is especially a treat for bird-watchers, with near-extinct species, such as the Swinhoe's Pheasant, residing in this region. Relax after the hike with some afternoon tea at Rollin Farm, before heading back to your hotel.

After a morning of intense biking, the Chang Lien-Cheng Saxophone Museum will allow you to relax and will give you an insight into the intriguing history behind one of the most loved instruments. strIntroduction: Visit the lovely lands of Cingjing Farm, a.k.a ‘The Green Green Grasslands' and delve into the rich history and culture of this beautiful part of Taiwan Enjoy the beautiful scenery of mountains and greenery at Cingjing Farm, famous for its abundance of sheep! Enjoy the beautiful scenery of mountains and greenery at Cingjing Farm, famous for its abundance of sheep! Visit the amazing construction of Chung Tai Chan Monastery, the largest Buddhist monastery in the world Visit the amazing construction of Chung Tai Chan Monastery, the largest Buddhist monastery in the world Visit the Puli Brewery, a native history museum and the lovely carp lake Visit the Puli Brewery, a native history museum and the lovely carp lake Hotel transfers, lunch, admission fees and afternoon tea are all included in the tour Hotel transfers, lunch, admission fees and afternoon tea are all included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: This is a day that allows you to delve into the countryside and history of beautiful Taiwan. The tour begins with a visit to Puli Brewery where you can watch the production of Shaoxing Wine in its hometown. Next, the spectacular Chung Tai Chan is the world's tallest Buddhist temple and certainly showcases some fascinating gold-accented architecture. After lunch, you'll visit Cingjing Farm, also known as “Green Green Grasslands,” for its lush greenery and the abundance of sheep that graze all around, not to mention the spectacular scenic views. Reenergize over afternoon tea before swinging by the aboriginal history museum and the atmospheric carp lake.

Visit the small but picturesque Jiji Township, followed by a daring trip across the famed Sky Bridge and a taste of world-renowned pineapple cakes Explore Jiji Township, well-known for its intriguing train station, thriving banana industry and delicious egg rolls Rent bicycles for an outdoorsy sightseeing adventure Walk across the Sky Bridge, a 204m long bridge giving you a grand view of greenery all around Treat yourself to delicious pineapple cakes at Sunny Hills View the world's largest kiln work at the Shueili Snake Kiln Inclusive of hotel transfers and lunch Explore Jiji Township, well-known for its intriguing train station, thriving banana industry and delicious egg rolls Explore Jiji Township, well-known for its intriguing train station, thriving banana industry and delicious egg rolls Rent bicycles for an outdoorsy sightseeing adventure Rent bicycles for an outdoorsy sightseeing adventure Walk across the Sky Bridge, a 204m long bridge giving you a grand view of greenery all around Walk across the Sky Bridge, a 204m long bridge giving you a grand view of greenery all around Treat yourself to delicious pineapple cakes at Sunny Hills Treat yourself to delicious pineapple cakes at Sunny Hills View the world's largest kiln work at the Shueili Snake Kiln View the world's largest kiln work at the Shueili Snake Kiln Inclusive of hotel transfers and lunch Inclusive of hotel transfers and lunch What We Love:   What We Love: Experience the small-town life in the quaint little village of Jiji, one of the smallest townships in Taiwan. Famous for its banana production and train station, Jiji provides inspiration to all those who visit it, and you simply cannot leave the town without taking pictures of all its unique and wonderful features! However, the tour does not stop here; take a daring trip across Sky Bridge, which spans a length of 204m, with exotic shrubbery below, giving you the feeling that you are walking amongst green, leafy clouds. The tour also includes Shueili Snake Kiln, where you will find the world's largest kiln work which has been featured in the Guinness Book of World Records. Finally, stop by at Sunny Hills, for some delicious, succulent pineapple cakes!
strTitle: Jiji Township and Sky Bridge Visit

strIntroduction: Spend a chilled out day at Sun Moon Lake, Taiwan's largest body of water, including a cable car ride, temple visit and a scenic cruise Visit Taiwan's most famous lake and hop on the Ropeway, an exhilarating cable car ride that gives you breathtaking views of the lake and the surrounding landscape Take a scenic boat ride on the lake and see Syuanguang Temple and Ida Thao Roam around by the lake, and enjoy the natural surroundings, visit Wenwu Temple or venture into the markets to buy some souvenirs Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance plus the cruise and ropeway costs all included Visit Taiwan's most famous lake and hop on the Ropeway, an exhilarating cable car ride that gives you breathtaking views of the lake and the surrounding landscape Visit Taiwan's most famous lake and hop on the Ropeway, an exhilarating cable car ride that gives you breathtaking views of the lake and the surrounding landscape Take a scenic boat ride on the lake and see Syuanguang Temple and Ida Thao Take a scenic boat ride on the lake and see Syuanguang Temple and Ida Thao Roam around by the lake, and enjoy the natural surroundings, visit Wenwu Temple or venture into the markets to buy some souvenirs Roam around by the lake, and enjoy the natural surroundings, visit Wenwu Temple or venture into the markets to buy some souvenirs Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance plus the cruise and ropeway costs all included Enjoy hotel transfers, lunch, insurance plus the cruise and ropeway costs all included What We Love:   What We Love: The largest lake in Taiwan, Sun Moon Lake does not fail to impress with its calm, refreshing waters, and scenic, mountainous surroundings. A boat cruise is undoubtedly the most relaxing way to take in the sights then embark on an epic journey aboard the Sun Moon Lake Ropeway, a cable car ride that gives you a bird-eye view of the vast lake below. Familiarize yourself with this beautiful setting by taking a walk along the lake on the “Rambling Journey” hiking trail, before getting your final dose of culture with a visit to Wenwu Temple, a sacred site with intricate decorations all over both the exterior and interior.
strTitle: A Day at Sun Moon Lake

strIntroduction: Take the challenge of a Snow Mountain hike, Taiwan's second highest, and breathe in the fresh alpine air, a spectacular sunrise and, of course, snow-capped peaks on this two-day, two-night trek Climb the 3886 meters of Snow Mountain (Xueshan) the second highest peak in Taiwan Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Uncover the alpine beauty of Xueshan and watch a spectacular sunrise from the top Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner Climb the 3886 meters of Snow Mountain (Xueshan) the second highest peak in Taiwan Climb the 3886 meters of Snow Mountain (Xueshan) the second highest peak in Taiwan Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Uncover the alpine beauty of Xueshan and watch a spectacular sunrise from the top Uncover the alpine beauty of Xueshan and watch a spectacular sunrise from the top Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner What We Love:   What We Love: Despite often being praised for it's warm and tropical climate, you might be surprised to discover a range of snow-capped peaks nestled in central Taiwan. The second highest is aptly named Snow Mountain (Xueshan) and offers hikers a challenging trek through beautiful pine forested hillsides opening to glorious mountain views of Sheipa National Park. You'll be led by passionate guides who are highly experienced with the routes and altitudes of Snow Mountain. Though not technically challenging, the route is demanding and requires a high level of fitness – but believe us, when you're marveling at the sunrise from the top, it'll be well worth it!

Discover the magical beauty of Shuiyang mountain, forest and lake on this two day, two night trek for moderately experienced hikers Hike to Shuiyang Forest and Lake and marvel at the eerie natural beauty of the area Enjoy spectacular views over Jade Mountain in the foothills of Alishan Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Camp out and dine in nature beside the lake for a night Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner Hike to Shuiyang Forest and Lake and marvel at the eerie natural beauty of the area Hike to Shuiyang Forest and Lake and marvel at the eerie natural beauty of the area Enjoy spectacular views over Jade Mountain in the foothills of Alishan Enjoy spectacular views over Jade Mountain in the foothills of Alishan Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Camp out and dine in nature beside the lake for a night Camp out and dine in nature beside the lake for a night Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner What We Love:   What We Love: Characterized by needle-thin vertical trees and said to have been formed by an earthquake centuries ago, Shuiyang Forest and Lake provides a mysteriously beautiful destination for an overnight camp. On this two-night excursion, you'll spend a night in a hostel before two days of trekking in the Shuiyang area. You'll pitch tents beside the lake and enjoy dinner under a spectacular starry night sky. Led by experienced hiking guides, this itinerary discovers the varied nature and off-the-beaten-path routes in the foothills of Mount Jade, ideal for intermediate hikers.

This lengthy but achievable hiking expedition, led by experienced mountain guides, takes you to the deep blue waters of teardrop-shaped Chiaming Lake Climb 3310m meters up Xiangyang Mountain to Chiaming Lake, famed for its deep blue colour Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Uncover alpine beauty, emerald forests and the natural tranquility of the lake Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus two breakfasts and two dinners Climb 3310m meters up Xiangyang Mountain to Chiaming Lake, famed for its deep blue colour Climb 3310m meters up Xiangyang Mountain to Chiaming Lake, famed for its deep blue colour Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Uncover alpine beauty, emerald forests and the natural tranquility of the lake Uncover alpine beauty, emerald forests and the natural tranquility of the lake Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus two breakfasts and two dinners Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus two breakfasts and two dinners What We Love:   What We Love: It's hard to believe that water can be so blue until you set eyes on Chiaming Lake, and easy to see why it's often referred to as the ‘angel's teardrop' or ‘the sapphire in the mountains'. Formed by a meteor impact millions of years ago, visiting this high-altitude lake makes a fantastic hike, complemented by surrounding views of Xiangyang Mountain's rolling green hills. On this 3-day, 2-night excursion, mountaineering enthusiasts will be led across Taiwan's scenic hill country by experienced guides, staying in mountain cabins, and getting a rare taste for the beauty of the area and the fresh alpine air.

Scale Taiwan's highest peak, Mount Jade, on a challenging expedition that's sure to reward you at the top! Climb the 3952 meters of Mount Jade (Yushan), the highest peak in Taiwan and northeast Asia! Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Uncover the hidden beauty of Yushan and watch a spectacular sunrise from the top Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner Climb the 3952 meters of Mount Jade (Yushan), the highest peak in Taiwan and northeast Asia! Climb the 3952 meters of Mount Jade (Yushan), the highest peak in Taiwan and northeast Asia! Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Be led by experienced guides and passionate lovers of Taiwan's mountains Uncover the hidden beauty of Yushan and watch a spectacular sunrise from the top Uncover the hidden beauty of Yushan and watch a spectacular sunrise from the top Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner Inclusive of two-nights accommodation plus one breakfast and one dinner What We Love:   What We Love: 3952 meters of Taiwan's toughest terrain but most rewarding natural views: this two night hike ventures to Mount Jade (Yushan), the highest peak in Northeast Asia. We won't pretend it's not a challenge, but the crisp mountain air, majestic alpine terrain, magical sunrise and overwhelming sense of achievement are well worth the grueling hike. This internationally renowned peak is a popular challenge, but permits must be applied for and being led by a passionate mountain-loving guide will make your life a whole lot easier. Accommodation along the way takes you back to nature as you sleep in mountain cabins, taking you a world away from televisions, Facebook, WiFi… in fact, electricity altogether! But if you're up for the challenge, we've got your expedition sorted.

Enjoy hot spring baths, trail walks and bird watching at stunning Taiping Mountain for a healthy dose of nature in Taiwan Explore the 24 hectares of Taiping Forest Park, Taiwan's most accessible virgin forest woodland Discover the remaining evidence of Yilan's illustrious logging history Wash your worries away in a long hot spring soak surrounded by forest nature Go on easy or more challenging mountain trails according to your preference Explore the 24 hectares of Taiping Forest Park, Taiwan's most accessible virgin forest woodland Discover the remaining evidence of Yilan's illustrious logging history Wash your worries away in a long hot spring soak surrounded by forest nature Go on easy or more challenging mountain trails according to your preference What We Love:   What We Love: As one of only three national research woodlands in Taiwan, Mt. Taiping is the perfect place for outdoor activities near Yilan. Highlights include hot spring baths at the Lenzhir Hot Springs, observation sheds to view the wildlife habitat and ecology of the woodlands, and a nature walk around the unspoiled virgin forest. There are walking and hiking routes throughout the national park offering marvellous views of snow-capped mountains backed by a sea of clouds.

Spend half a day mastering the basics of stand up paddle boarding in Yilan, an increasingly popular beach activity in Taiwan Try out paddle boarding in Taiwan, a water sport that is increasingly popular around the world Feel safe with professional instructors and world class equipment Get a fantastic view of Yilan at the sea cape and cliffs of Neipi Beach Try out paddle boarding in Taiwan, a water sport that is increasingly popular around the world Feel safe with professional instructors and world class equipment Get a fantastic view of Yilan at the sea cape and cliffs of Neipi Beach  What We Love:   What We Love: Experience paddle boarding to the changing waves and wind at Neipi Beach in Yilan, known for its fine white sands. Experienced coaches will help you set up the SUP equipment before you paddle on the water. Feel completely at ease as safety boats and instructors will be keeping an eye on you as you get to grips with your gear. Once you've mastered the basics, raise your gaze and begin to appreciate the natural surrounds and idyllic scenery.

Explore local fish markets, find out about mackerel fishing and memorable seafood delicacies famed in Nanfang'ao Have an experienced guide show you around the local fish market for the freshest fish in Nangfang'ao Visit the cultural centre where the history of the local fishing industry and unique mackerel fishing methods are displayed Take in the beautiful harbor views as you enjoy afternoon tea in Nanfang'ao Taste a delectable local meal of mackerel and rice Have an experienced guide show you around the local fish market for the freshest fish in Nangfang'ao Visit the cultural centre where the history of the local fishing industry and unique mackerel fishing methods are displayed Take in the beautiful harbor views as you enjoy afternoon tea in Nanfang'ao Taste a delectable local meal of mackerel and rice What We Love:   What We Love: One of Taiwan's three major fishing ports, Nanfang'ao is a seafood haven and an important location for fisheries on the east coast of Taiwan. Locals flock to the harbour daily for the fresh seafood delicacies featuring local speciality dishes and unique cooking approaches. On the tour you'll have the chance to experience the spectacular ocean views of Nanfang'ao and Neipi Beach, visit the Fisherfolk Culture Museum, see the Nanning Fish Market in action and chow down on a local rice and mackerel dinner as an appropriate finish to your day.

Spend a day in the life of a Taiwanese farmer in Yilan County on this unique organic farming experience Enjoy the tranquil environment of Fairy Tale Village Farm and feast on an organic lunch Visit a local market and the beautifully decorated suspension bridge at Meihua Lake Discover the lifestyle and culture of the farming community when you meet the locals Enjoy the tranquil environment of Fairy Tale Village Farm and feast on an organic lunch Visit a local market and the beautifully decorated suspension bridge at Meihua Lake Discover the lifestyle and culture of the farming community when you meet the locals What We Love:   What We Love: Get away from the hustle and bustle of Taiwan cities and go back to local roots with a farming village visit instead. After a fascinating history of age-old practices dating back to their ancestors, the local farmers will give you the chance to try your hand at farming with zero previous experience needed. Visit the local farmers' market to see the wide variety of food available and feast on the organic produce that you picked during the day to round off this wholesome Taiwanese experience.

Enjoy nature for the day at Meihua Lake on a guided tour from Yilan by bicycle, foot and on a cruise Visit Sanqing Temple, which overlooks Meihua Lake and learn about its architecture Relax on a tranquil river cruise or cycle ride around the lake Enjoy a leisurely afternoon tea at the lakeside cafe Visit Sanqing Temple, which overlooks Meihua Lake and learn about its architecture Relax on a tranquil river cruise or cycle ride around the lake Enjoy a leisurely afternoon tea at the lakeside cafe What We Love:   What We Love: Spend a leisurely afternoon visiting Meihua Lake to enjoy the scenic natural landscape. You will be greeted with lush greenery and fresh air where you can spend time walking, cycling and cruising on the lake. Another highlight is Sanqing Temple - located on the southern slopes of Meihua Lake, the architecture of the temple resembles traditional imperial court designs and is well worth a look. Complete your afternoon with a delectable tea break at Salex cafe as you gaze over those beautiful lake views.

Get a comprehensive overview of local history and culture on this half day tour of the main attractions in Yilan Listen to traditional opera at the Taiwan Theater Museum Step into the cartoon world of Jimmy Liao, a famed Taiwanese artist Discover the wine making process and enjoy a tasting at Yilan Distillery Chia Chi Lan Wine Museum Marvel at the unique Japanese-style Yilan Museum of Literature Enjoy a cup of tea at the Old Bookcase Cafe where you can also browse the shelves Listen to traditional opera at the Taiwan Theater Museum Step into the cartoon world of Jimmy Liao, a famed Taiwanese artist Discover the wine making process and enjoy a tasting at Yilan Distillery Chia Chi Lan Wine Museum Marvel at the unique Japanese-style Yilan Museum of Literature Enjoy a cup of tea at the Old Bookcase Cafe where you can also browse the shelves What We Love:   What We Love: Go on a rich cultural journey to explore the architecture, culture, art and history of Yilan accompanied by an English speaking guide. Discover the interesting fusion of Japanese wooden houses and Western classical design in local buildings and learn about Taiwan's development at the city museum. Sample tasty beverages at the Wine Museum as the process of wine making is explained to you. Be inspired at the Museum of Literature then relax with a steaming cuppa as you browse vintage books at the Old Bookcase Cafe. Step into the cartoon world of popular illustrator Jimmy Liao before ending your packed afternoon of getting to know Yilan.

Learn more about local crafts then enjoy a scenic boat cruise along the Dongshan River on a half day tour Pay a visit to the National Center for Traditional Arts where Taiwan's cultural history, arts and crafts are on display Enjoy the beautiful scenery from the boat as you cruise Dongshan River Take a bike tour along the Dongshan River Water Park and marvel at the orange glow of the sunset Pay a visit to the National Center for Traditional Arts where Taiwan's cultural history, arts and crafts are on display Enjoy the beautiful scenery from the boat as you cruise Dongshan River Take a bike tour along the Dongshan River Water Park and marvel at the orange glow of the sunset What We Love:   What We Love: Start your afternoon at the National Centre for Traditional Arts where you will see a candy making demonstration and can try your hand at soap or indigo making. Discover unique shops with souvenirs, snacks and other handicraft items available for sale before embarking on a leisurely boat trip along Dongshan River. Relax on the riverbank at Dongshan River Water Park as you tie up your day with a marvelous sunset.

Under the skilful lead of a professional guide, you'll get an true nature experience hiking and camping at the ethereal Chia Lo Lake Hike through huge ancient trees and dense forest to discover one of Yilan's most beautiful lakes Camp at a mountain lodge beside the peaceful lake and wake to see the fog floating on the surface of the lake in the cool morning Soak up the nighttime beauty where thousands of twinkling stars will be clearly visible at night Accompanied by professional and experienced guide, learn about the area's history, topography, astronomy and wildlife Your evening meal and second day breakfast plus a sleeping bag are prepared for you Hike through huge ancient trees and dense forest to discover one of Yilan's most beautiful lakes Camp at a mountain lodge beside the peaceful lake and wake to see the fog floating on the surface of the lake in the cool morning Soak up the nighttime beauty where thousands of twinkling stars will be clearly visible at night Accompanied by professional and experienced guide, learn about the area's history, topography, astronomy and wildlife Your evening meal and second day breakfast plus a sleeping bag are prepared for you What We Love:   What We Love: A camping experience for those of us who want a extra helping hand organising a camping experience! Throughout this two day one night experience, you'll stay at a mountain house and be accompanied by an expert camping guide who will take command of the campsite. All food, sleeping bags and camping gear is provided and prepared so you can take the time to appreciate Chia Lo Lake where, legend goes, a fairy spilt a pearl necklace scattering the pearls across the land and creating the mirror-like reflections of these lakes. Each morning an ethereal fog floats above the lake whilst at night you'll be able to see a map of stars twinkling above you. It might be just a short journey from the city, but just a few hours of hiking and you'll feel like you're in a different world - the perfect nature escape from Taipei.
strTitle: 2D1N Chia Lo Lake Camping from Taipei

strIntroduction: INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Rent a modern and safe scooter for a day's hire and travel the island like a local Penghu's light traffic and smooth roads are ideal for inexperienced or new riders Penghu-wide coverage meaning you cant rent from a number of different islands Inclusive of all safety equipment and insurance Penghu's light traffic and smooth roads are ideal for inexperienced or new riders Penghu-wide coverage meaning you cant rent from a number of different islands Inclusive of all safety equipment and insurance What We Love:   What We Love: Navigate the beautiful Penghu Archipelago on two wheels with a day's scooter rental. Travel like the locals do and cruise around Penghu's scenic roads, taking in the ocean views whilst riding on a new and stylish scooter. With coverage all over the island chain, explore Penghu's many places of interest and travel around at your own pace. With little traffic to contend with, the scooter hire is the perfect way to explore, and a safe option too for riders with little or no experience.

Take part in a number of exciting water activities at the 'Home of the Stone Weirs' Take in the beautiful coastline of Jibei Island which stretches on for miles Participate in different water sports such as banana boating, snorkelling, jet skiing and more Tour this scenic island like a local on a scooter included in the package Return boat ticket to Jibei included Take in the beautiful coastline of Jibei Island which stretches on for miles Participate in different water sports such as banana boating, snorkelling, jet skiing and more Tour this scenic island like a local on a scooter included in the package Return boat ticket to Jibei included What We Love:   What We Love: From Magong take the short boat ride to the Jibei - one of the most secluded and remote parts of the Penghu Archipelago and relax whilst taking in the miles of unspoiled coastline in front of you. A paradise for sea lovers, the white sandy beaches and clear blue seas surrounding the island make the ideal location to enjoy thrilling water sports such as banana boating, jet skiing, snorkelling and more. Well known as a rich fishing ground since the days of the Ming Dynasty, Jibei Island is a well-known historical landmark in Taiwan for its dozens of heart-shaped stone weirs, with more located here than any other island.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Sample some of Penghu's finest beach activities and water sports with a 1 day unlimited pass Get out onto the water and try a number of adrenaline fuelled activities such as banana boating and jet skiing Truly unlimited use means you can try everything as many times as you wish without instruction Run by an operator with years of experience in Penghu's water sports industry, you'll be sure to have a safe and memorable time Get out onto the water and try a number of adrenaline fuelled activities such as banana boating and jet skiing Truly unlimited use means you can try everything as many times as you wish without instruction Run by an operator with years of experience in Penghu's water sports industry, you'll be sure to have a safe and memorable time What We Love:   What We Love: Stretched out along 3km of unspoiled white sands, Aimen beach is amongst Penghu's most stunning locations and one of the most suitable spots for engaging in water sports and other beach based activities. Considered one the best beaches in Penghu, if not the whole of Taiwan, it is perfect place for an unlimited 1 day pass including but not limited to, jet skiing, beach volleyball, snorkelling, tube riding as well as our favourite, the iconic banana boat! If at any point you decide you need a break from all of the fun, simply relax on the beach and soak up the sun.

Set sail from Magong and head for two of Penghu's most beautiful islands, cruising in style on Penghu's newest and fastest fleet, giving you more of a chance to take in the view Enjoy the morning sun whilst setting sail from Magong harbour First visit Wang'an Islet, famed for its idyllic scenery and endangered turtles with an optional trip to the island's turtle protection centre included Stop for a few hours at Chimei Island, a photographer, and nature lover's heaven Hop between islands in style on Penghu's fastest fleet of island to island ferries Enjoy the morning sun whilst setting sail from Magong harbour First visit Wang'an Islet, famed for its idyllic scenery and endangered turtles with an optional trip to the island's turtle protection centre included Stop for a few hours at Chimei Island, a photographer, and nature lover's heaven Hop between islands in style on Penghu's fastest fleet of island to island ferries What We Love:   What We Love: Although the Penghu Archipelago is made up of 64 islands and islets, this 7 hour tour lets you get closer to 2 of Penghu's most idyllic islands, both home to rare wildlife, pristine coastline and ancient Fujianese architecture. Located to the south of the main Island, first set sail for the island of Wang'an discovering local wildlife and taking in the amazing ocean views before spending a further few hours exploring the charms of distant Chimei, a photographer's heaven and home to Penghu's iconic heart-shaped fishing weirs. After hopping from one island to the next, cruise gently back into harbour at Magong.

Discover the natural beauty of Chimei, Penghu's southernmost island, on land and under the sea with this dual motorbiking and snorkeling experience Fully appreciate the beauty of Chimei by motorbike and by snorkeling See the double heart-shaped rock weir, Chimei's famous basalt rocks and the island's colorful coral Return ferry tickets from Magong city to Chimei included Scoot around the island by motorbike for 2 people with fuel included Fully appreciate the beauty of Chimei by motorbike and by snorkeling See the double heart-shaped rock weir, Chimei's famous basalt rocks and the island's colorful coral Return ferry tickets from Magong city to Chimei included Scoot around the island by motorbike for 2 people with fuel included What We Love:   What We Love: As one of the most distant outer islands south of Penghu, Chimei promises to provide a delightful retreat to soak in the tranquility and nature of this beautiful isle. Chimei is steeped in tradition and historic stories such as the tale of the seven beauties (七美) from where the island takes its name and the unique stone weir for trapping fish in the shape of a double heart. Get a deep cultural insight into Japan's national sport with a guided visit to watch real sumo wrestlers complete their morning training Get a close up look at the sumo wrestlers' morning fight practice Observe the physical practice and cultural traditions of sumo for around 2 hours Your informative tour guide will ensure that you gain an in depth knowledge of everything to do with this historic Japanese sport Get a close up look at the sumo wrestlers' morning fight practice Get a close up look at the sumo wrestlers' morning fight practice Observe the physical practice and cultural traditions of sumo for around 2 hours Observe the physical practice and cultural traditions of sumo for around 2 hours Your informative tour guide will ensure that you gain an in depth knowledge of everything to do with this historic Japanese sport Your informative tour guide will ensure that you gain an in depth knowledge of everything to do with this historic Japanese sport What We Love:   What We Love: It's a fair statement to say that sumo wrestling must be one of the world's most unique national sports. Sumo originated in Japan as early as the 1600s and Japan remains the only country where this heavyweight sport is practiced professionally. Fighters live in communal 'stables' where every aspect of their daily lives is dictated by strict tradition. These traditions, etiquette and customs are not taken lightly. Many sumo stables are not open to foreign visitors and for those that are, even spectactors are expected to adhere to certain rules. Luckily this tour includes a local guide who will pick you up from your hotel and thoroughly prep you on everything you need to know before watching the sumos in their morning training rituals. It's a unique Japanese experience and far more than just a fight, as you'll soon find out...

Japan's national beverage is made by fermenting rice, and comes in hundreds of different varieties hailing from all corners of the country.
